elements.title: Direct Bitcoin Integration
elements.overview: Native integration with the Bitcoin blockchain. Trustless reading from and writing to the Bitcoin network from canister smart contracts.

elements.title: Threshold ECDSA Signatures (a.k.a. Chain-key ECDSA)
elements.overview: Threshold ECDSA protocol suite based on multi-party computation (MPC). Enables trustless integrations with ECDSA-based chains.

elements.title: ECDSA key rotation and resharing
elements.overview: Periodic key rotation and resharing to improve resilience against adaptive attacks against the threshold ECDSA protocol.

elements.title: Chain-key Bitcoin (ckBTC) token
elements.overview: Twin token of Bitcoin on ICP, realized with the native Bitcoin integration and threshold ECDSA. Fast, low-fee Bitcoin transfers on ICP.

elements.title: X-chain token minter V1 (ERC20-ICP)
elements.overview: First version of the X-chain token minter bringing the ICP token to Ethereum.

elements.title: Chain-key Ether (ckETH) token
elements.overview: Ethereum's Ether token on ICP in the form of a "twin token" called ckETH (chain-key ETH).

elements.title: RPC canister for Ethereum & EVM integration
elements.overview: Integration of ICP with EVM blockchains via a canister that accesses JSON RPC providers through HTTPS outcalls. Works for Ethereum and other EVM chains with RPC providers.

elements.title: Threshold ECDSA signing latency & throughput improvements
elements.overview: Reducing the latency of threshold ECDSA signing operations by reducing the number of required consensus rounds through protocol improvements. Also results in a throughput improvement.

elements.title: Chain-key ERC20 (ckERC20) tokens & ckUSDC
elements.overview: A subset of Ethereum's ERC20 tokens on ICP in the form of "twin tokens" called ckERC20 (chain-key ERC20). ckUSDC is to be among the first ckERC20 tokens.

elements.title: Chain Fusion Supports EVM Chains
elements.description: ICP’s Chain Fusion technology has full support for Ethereum and other EVM chains. ICP smart contracts can read from and write to EVM chains using a decentralized approach as well as sign transactions in a trustless manner using threshold ECDSA signing. This allows ICP smart contracts to augment EVM-based smart contracts with additional functionality through ICP's superpowers, transfer tokens on other chains, and call smart contracts on EVM chains.

elements.title: Threshold Schnorr signing
elements.overview: Threshold Schnorr signing support based on multiparty computation (MPC). Enables trustless integrations with the Bitcoin network using Schnorr-BIP340 for supporting inscriptions.

elements.title: Onchain Bitcoin block headers
elements.overview: Exposing an onchain API to access all Bitcoin block headers to enable dapps to trustlessly access the full Bitcoin block content.

elements.title: Chain Fusion Supports Bitcoin ordinals and runes
elements.description: ICP’s Chain Fusion technology has full support for Bitcoin protocols such as BRC20 and Runes. So far, ICP’s fully-onchain capabilities have been largely applied to use cases where Bitcoin is used as a means of value transfer, its original purpose. This milestone provides additional functionality that enables smart contracts to index and issue prominent types of Bitcoin inscriptions in a completely decentralized manner for the first time, thereby putting ICP into a unique position among all chains.
